ids_alerts.rule_msg: TGI HUNT Malicious Host Artifact String in HTTP (base64 Microsoft Windows)
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"TGI HUNT Malicious Host Artifact String in HTTP (base64 Microsoft Windows)"; flow:established; content:"TWljcm9zb2Z0IFdpbmRvd3Mg"; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2610736; rev:1;)

children: @{process_id=5224; name="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle hidden -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -nologo -noprofile -file C:\Users\Public\Documents\Updater.ps1; children=System.Object[]; files_written=System.Object[]; files_deleted=System.Object[]}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Binaries and Scripts in Public Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a file with a suspicious extension in the public folder, which could indicate potential malicious activity.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Application File Write to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Windows shells and scripting applications that write files to suspicious folders

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Execution of Powershell Script in Public Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: This rule detects execution of PowerShell scripts located in the "C:\Users\Public" folder

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded FromBase64String Cmdlet
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

values.ScriptBlockText:
$Excel = New-Object -ComObject Excel.Application
$ExcelVersion = $Excel.Version
for($i=10; $i -le 20; $i++){
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security" -Name AccessVBOM -PropertyType DWORD -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security" -Name VBAWarnings -PropertyType DWORD -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security\ProtectedView" -Name Disabl [TRUNCATED]

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell Download - Powershell Script
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: WmiPrvSE Spawned A Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects WmiPrvSE spawning a process

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

values.ScriptBlockText: [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([System.Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell WindowStyle Option
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Scheduled Task Creation Via Schtasks.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script Dropped Via PowerShell.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder

sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE

The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded FromBase64String Cmdlet
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious SYSTEM User Process Creation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), David ANDRE (additional keywords)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Office Autorun Keys Modification
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

values.ScriptBlockText: [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([System.Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell WindowStyle Option
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

values.ScriptBlockText:
$Excel = New-Object -ComObject Excel.Application
$ExcelVersion = $Excel.Version
for($i=10; $i -le 20; $i++){
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security" -Name AccessVBOM -PropertyType DWORD -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security" -Name VBAWarnings -PropertyType DWORD -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security\ProtectedView" -Name DisableAtta [TRUNCATED]

$Excel = New-Object -ComObject Excel.Application
$ExcelVersion = $Excel.Version

New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security" -Name VBAWarnings -PropertyType DWORD -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Office\$i.0\excel\Security\ProtectedView" -Name DisableAtta [TRUNCATED]

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation From Script Engines
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example.
Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Scheduled Task Creation Via Schtasks.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell Get Current User
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.
